detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Stage lighting principles and practice. Equipment, control systems and design fundamentals. Priority will be given to BFA Design and Production majors.

If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding waitlist section. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding waitlist section. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This class focuses on the modern, Western-style spoken theatre in Asia in the 20th century, with plays from China, Japan, India, Indonesia, Korea, and Vietnam. Modern Asian theatre started in late 19th and early 20th centuries as a result of global colonialism, either introduced to colonized countries such as India as part of colonial cultural hegemony or adopted by elite intellectuals in semicolonial nations such as China and Japan to stage nationalism and reform indigenous theatre. We will read and discuss plays and watch videos from early, mid, and late 20th century by playwrights from these nations so as to examine the process in which this foreign theatrical form became part of the Asian theatrical scene, as well as the relationship between modern spoken drama and traditional theatre in these countries.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Priority will be given to BFA Design and Production majors who have successfully completed Theatre 250.

If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding wait list section -  THTR 350, Section WL1. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the Department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/

This course takes place on the Frederic Wood stage, and in the shops.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Special topic: Creative Electronics. Introduction to tools, theory, and materials for artist-built electronics, and to previous creative electronics artworks. With a focus on D.I.Y. making – as both activity and attitude – the course will be largely hands-on, equipping students to understand basic electrical theory, electrical/electronic components, circuit construction, and control elements; and to write code for the open-source Arduino microcontroller. Course work will include a number of lab exercises, critical and technical analyses of artworks, and student artwork production.

Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
